About Automic's SCVMM Package ================================ System Center Virtual Machine Manager (SCVMM) forms part of Microsoft's System Center line of virtual machine management and reporting tools, alongside previously established tools such as System Center Operations Manager and System Center Configuration Manager. SCVMM is designed for management of large numbers of Virtual Servers based on Microsoft Virtual Server and Hyper-V. System Center Virtual Machine Manager enables increased physical server utilization by making possible simple and fast consolidation on virtual infrastructure. VMM enables rapid provisioning of new virtual machines by the administrator and end users using a self-service provisioning tool. VMM also provides the central management console to manage all the building blocks of a virtualized data center.
This Action pack can be used to automate the provisioning of Virtual Machines in SCVMM environment such as follows. * Virtual Machine Poer Management. E.g. Start/Stop/Resume VM. * Clone VM, Create VM from template, ReConfigure VM. * Add Virtual Drive to VM * Retrieve VM(s)/VM Details/VM Performance Data. * Managing Checkpoints of VM
=Supported versions= System Center Virtual Machine Manager 2012
=Limitations=
=Setup= * Oracle JRE 1.7 or higher must be installed on Agent OS and "java" must be set as executable on the same. * The Agent should be able to access the VMM server. * Powershell version 4 or higher. * Module VirtualMachineManager should be present on Agent machine which comes with VMM admin console installation. * If you are using PowerShell version 5 or above on agent OS, then this action pack will require Automic ITPA Shared package version 1.2.2 or higher. * Connection details to the VMM server. * This action pack can also connect to SCVMM server using IPV6 address. If you want to provide IPV6 address, it must be specified as [<IPV6 Address>]. E.g. [fe80::cd7d:edbb:7dda:7d57]
=Actions= Following actions are supported for SCVMM:
* Action Name: PCK.AUTOMIC_SCVMM.PUB.ACTION.GET_VM * Action Description: This action is used to get the details of a Virtual Machine
* Action Name: PCK.AUTOMIC_SCVMM.PUB.ACTION.NEW_VM_FROM_VM * Action Description: This action is used to create a virtual machine from an existing stopped virtual machine deployed on a host.
* Action Name: PCK.AUTOMIC_SCVMM.PUB.ACTION.STOP_VM * Action Description: This action is used to stop a Virtual Machine
* Action Name: PCK.AUTOMIC_SCVMM.PUB.ACTION.START_VM * Action Description: This action is used to start a Virtual Machine
* Action Name: PCK.AUTOMIC_SCVMM.PUB.ACTION.REMOVE_VM * Action Description: This action is used to remove a Virtual Machine
* Action Name: PCK.AUTOMIC_SCVMM.PUB.ACTION.CREATE_CHECKPOINT * Action Description: This action is used to create a checkpoint of VM.
* Action Name: PCK.AUTOMIC_SCVMM.PUB.ACTION.SUSPEND_VM * Action Description: This action is used to suspend a Virtual Machine
* Action Name: PCK.AUTOMIC_SCVMM.PUB.ACTION.RESTORE_CHECKPOINT * Action Description: This action is used to restore VM to a checkpoint.
* Action Name: PCK.AUTOMIC_SCVMM.PUB.ACTION.RESUME_VM * Action Description: This action is used to resume the given VM from paused state.
* Action Name: PCK.AUTOMIC_SCVMM.PUB.ACTION.NEW_DISK_DRIVE * Action Description: This action is used to attach a new disk drive or existing VHD to a VM.
* Action Name: PCK.AUTOMIC_SCVMM.PUB.ACTION.NEW_VM_FROM_TEMPLATE * Action Description: This action is used to create a virtual machine from an existing template.
* Action Name: PCK.AUTOMIC_SCVMM.PUB.ACTION.GET_CHECKPOINTS * Action Description: This action is used to get virtual machine checkpoint object(s) from the VMM database.
* Action Name: PCK.AUTOMIC_SCVMM.PUB.ACTION.MOVE_VM * Action Description: This action is used to move a Virtual Machine to a Target VM Host and Destination Path.
* Action Name: PCK.AUTOMIC_SCVMM.PUB.ACTION.GET_DISK_DRIVE * Action Description: This action is used to get a virtual disk drive object(s).
* Action Name: PCK.AUTOMIC_SCVMM.PUB.ACTION.GET_VM_NAMES * Action Description: This action is used to retrieve VM(s) and publish VM(s) name separated by comma along with the total count
* Action Name: PCK.AUTOMIC_SCVMM.PUB.ACTION.REMOVE_CHECKPOINTS * Action Description: This action is used to remove checkpoints of a Virtual Machine.
* Action Name: PCK.AUTOMIC_SCVMM.PUB.ACTION.SAVE_STATE_VM * Action Description: This action is used to save the state of a Virtual Machine.
* Action Name: PCK.AUTOMIC_SCVMM.PUB.ACTION.REMOVE_LATEST_CHECKPOINT * Action Description: This action is used to remove the latest checkpoint of a virtual machine
* Action Name: PCK.AUTOMIC_SCVMM.PUB.ACTION.DISCARD_SAVED_STATE_VM * Action Description: This action is used to discard the saved state of a virtual machine
* Action Name: PCK.AUTOMIC_SCVMM.PUB.ACTION.GET_HOST_GROUPS * Action Description: This action is used to get one or more host groups from a SCVMM database.
* Action Name: PCK.AUTOMIC_SCVMM.PUB.ACTION.GET_VM_PERFORMANCE * Action Description: This action is used to get the performance data for Virtual machine(s).
* Action Name: PCK.AUTOMIC_SCVMM.PUB.ACTION.RECONFIGURE_VM * Action Description: This action is used to change the properties of provided virtual machine managed by Virtual Machine Manager (VMM).
* Action Name: PCK.AUTOMIC_SCVMM.PUB.ACTION.GET_VM_HOST_VOLUMES * Action Description: This action is used to get one or more storage volume objects for the specified VM Host managed by Virtual Machine Manager (VMM).
* Action Name: PCK.AUTOMIC_SCVMM.PUB.ACTION.GET_VM_ATTRIBUTE * Action Description: This action is used to get provided attribute value from VM.
